definitions.definition: Any of genus Cynomys, small, stout-bodied burrowing rodents with shallow cheek pouches, native to North America and Central America.
To pop up from a hole or similar in a manner that resembles the way a prairie dog pops his head up from his burrow.
To struggle to hold back an involuntary bowel movement.
Happening or appearing in the night; night-time; nocturnal.
definitions.example: A cobweb spread above a blossom Is sufficient to protect It from nightly chill. — Tyndall.

definitions.definition: Performing, occurring, or taking place every night.
definitions.example: The dog demanded to go out for his nightly walk.

definitions.definition: Used in the night.
A build of a software program with the latest changes, released every night.
Every night.
definitions.example: He checks his email nightly.

definitions.definition: A style of art that emphasises extreme simplicity of form.
A style of music that emphasises extreme simplicity of rhythms and melodic forms to achieve a trancelike effect.
The rank or office of an archbishop
The jurisdiction of an archbishop; an archdiocese
A small, one-wheeled (rarely two-wheeled) cart with handles at one end for transporting small loads.
To convey in a wheelbarrow.
To cause the weight of an aeroplane to become concentrated around the nosewheel.
Chaos; a chaotic situation lacking rules or control.
definitions.example: When the fire alarm went off, it was a free-for-all.

definitions.definition: Deathmatch, sometimes specifically one in which every player is pitted against all the others.
A coniferous tree of the genus Cedrus in the family Pinaceae.
A coniferous tree of the family Cupressaceae, especially of the genera Juniperus, Cupressus, Calocedrus, or Thuja.
A flowering tree of the family Meliaceae, especially of the genera Cedrela or Toona.
The aromatic wood from a Cedrus tree, or from any of several unrelated trees.
A plant, Atropa belladonna, having purple bell-shaped flowers and poisonous black glossy berries.
An alkaloid extracted from this plant, sometimes used medicinally, containing atropine.
A verbal or written description of a coat of arms.
A formalized language for describing a coat of arms.
A coat of arms or a banner depicting a coat of arms.
Ostentatious display, verbal or otherwise; publication; description; record.
To describe a coat of arms.
To make widely or generally known, to proclaim.
To display conspicuously or publicly.
To shine; to be conspicuous.
To deck; to embellish; to adorn.
A court convened to decide matters and make orders in relation to family law, such as custody of children.
To drive mad; to craze
Insane or mentally ill.
Suffering from dementia.
Crazy; ridiculous.
definitions.example: a demented idea

definitions.definition: A rough fight.
In some team sports, especially soccer, a practice game which does not count on a team's record.
In American football or Canadian football, a play that begins with a snap from the center while opposing teams are on either side of a line of scrimmage.
To have, or be involved in, a scrimmage.
definitions.example: We scrimmaged a few times and then settled into boring drills.

definitions.definition: An action which demonstrates great skill or artistry.
A consultant or consulting firm.
definitions.example: For a PR campaign like never before, one needs a consultancy of unprecedented scope and power.

definitions.definition: The services offered by a consultant.
definitions.example: I've been doing IT consultancy for three years.

definitions.definition: To pierce or to wound (somebody) with a pointed tool or weapon, especially a knife or dagger.
definitions.example: If you stab him in the heart he won't live long enough to retaliate.

definitions.definition: To thrust in a stabbing motion.
definitions.example: to stab a dagger into a person

definitions.definition: To recklessly hit with the tip of a pointed object, such as a weapon or finger (often used with at).
definitions.example: He stabbed at my face with the twig but luckily kept missing my eyes.

definitions.definition: To cause a sharp, painful sensation (often used with at).
definitions.example: The snow from the blizzard was stabbing at my face as I skied down the mountain.

definitions.definition: To injure secretly or by malicious falsehood or slander.
definitions.example: to stab a person's reputation

definitions.definition: To roughen a brick wall with a pick so as to hold plaster.
To pierce folded sheets, near their back edges, for the passage of thread or wire.
An incident in which a person is stabbed.
definitions.example: A stabbing took place in the alley last night.

definitions.definition: (of pain) Sharp, intense.
definitions.example: Too much running gives me a stabbing pain in the chest.

definitions.definition: A system of recording or reproducing sound that uses two channels, each playing a portion of the original sound in such a way as to create the illusion of locating the sound at a particular position, each offset from the other, thereby more accurately imitating the location of the original sound when the recorded or reproduced sound is heard.
(by extension) Any object or device equipped with audio components that reproduces sound in stereo, such as a stereo console in the home.
definitions.example: He liked to listen to classical music on his stereo.

definitions.definition: A stereotype.
To create a stereophotographic image of.
Of sound, music, etc, recorded in stereo.
Of a pair of images: one depicting the view as would be seen from one eye and the other from the other eye, so that when viewed appropriately, they combine to give an impression of three dimensions.
A sandwich consisting of a frankfurter, or wiener, in a bread roll, usually served with ketchup, mustard, relish, etc.
A sausage of the type used as a general ingredient in this sandwich.
A show-off or daredevil, especially in such sports as surfing, skateboarding, or skiing.
A battered, deep-fried sausage or saveloy on a stick.
The penis.
A sexually suggestive physical gesture involving hip movement.
A distant, near-impossible goal.
definitions.example: Nanotechnology is the holy grail of medicine.

definitions.definition: A simple saddle girth used in Mexico.
Something that is very easy to do.
definitions.example: No problem. It's a cinch.

definitions.definition: A firm hold.
To bring to certain conclusion.
To tighten down.

A variety of auction pitch in which a draw to improve the hand is added, and the five of trumps (called "right Pedro") and the five of the same colour (called "left Pedro", and ranking between the five and the four of trumps) are each worth five. Fifty-one points make a game.
In the game of cinch, to protect (a trick) by playing a higher trump than the five.
A person, usually a woman, who is trained to assist women in childbirth, but who is not a physician.
definitions.example: A hundred years ago, a midwife would bring the baby into the world - going to a hospital to deliver a baby was either impossible or unheard of.

definitions.definition: Someone who assists in bringing about some result or project.
To act as a midwife
To facilitate the emergence of
The forwardmost part of an aircraft, rocket or missile; it is shaped to minimise aerodynamic resistance
Word blindness, the inability, due to a cerebral disorder, to comprehend or understand writing.
Any member of a mainly New World passerine bird family Troglodytidae; true wren.
Small bird of similar appearance to a true wren.
An ice cream cone with two scoops of ice cream.
definitions.example: We each got double-dips with chocolate on top and strawberry on the bottom.

definitions.definition: (roller coasters) A hill that levels off for a while about halfway down.
Ellipsis of double-dip recession
definitions.example: The UK is currently experiencing a double-dip.

definitions.definition: The drawing of a government pension or benefit for one job while also working in the government at another job, or of two pensions at the same time as a result of reaching the retirement criteria twice for the same entity.
To dip a piece of food (e.g. a chip) into a communal sauce container after already having taken a bite of the food.
definitions.example: I don't mind double-dipping when eating with my family, but I'd be embarrassed to do it when out with friends.

definitions.definition: To be illegitimately compensated a second time for the same activity.
definitions.example: He got caught double-dipping by billing the government directly as well as the primary contractor.

definitions.definition: To draw a government pension or benefit for one job while also working in the government at another job, or to draw two pensions at the same time as a result of reaching the retirement criteria twice for the same entity.
To re-release a movie or TV series, sometimes as a compilation or with additional features.
To use a single debt instrument to obtain interest tax expense (and therefore a lower tax base) in two or more tax jurisdictions.
To defeat a team twice in the finals.
definitions.example: SPC Ladies double-dipped the Sudbury Storm in the NSA Canadian World Series.

definitions.definition: To enroll in a single class which will fulfill two different requirements of a course of study.
The principles and practices of an ascetic; extreme self-denial and austerity.
The immature young of an eagle; an eagle chick.
The act of checking in at a hotel, airport, etc.
The submission of source code or other material to a source control repository.
The gray wolf, specifically all subspecies of the gray wolf (Canis lupus) that are not dingoes or dogs.
definitions.example: Check out my pet. He's a wolf.

definitions.definition: A man who makes amorous advances to many women.
A wolf tone or wolf note.
definitions.example: The soft violin solo was marred by persistent wolves.

definitions.definition: Any very ravenous, rapacious, or destructive person or thing; especially, want; starvation.
definitions.example: They toiled hard to keep the wolf from the door.

definitions.definition: One of the destructive, and usually hairy, larvae of several species of beetles and grain moths.
A white worm, or maggot, which infests granaries.
An eating ulcer or sore. See lupus.
A willying machine.
To devour; to gobble; to eat (something) voraciously.
To make amorous advances to many women; to hit on women; to cruise for sex.
To hunt for wolves.
The body of law dealing with the private relations between members of a community; it contrasts with criminal law, military law and ecclesiastical law.
Legal system based on the Corpus Juris Civilis; it contrasts with common law.
A rock of crystalline limestone.
(games) A small ball, usually of glass or ceramic.
An artwork made from marble.
definitions.example: The Elgin Marbles were originally part of the temple of the Parthenon.

definitions.definition: To cause (something to have) the streaked or swirled appearance of certain types of marble, for example by mixing viscous ingredients incompletely, or by applying paint or other colorants unevenly.
To get or have the streaked or swirled appearance of certain types of marble, for example due to the incomplete mixing of viscous ingredients, or the uneven application of paint or other colorants.
To cause meat, usually beef, pork, or lamb, to be interlaced with fat so that its appearance resembles that of marble.
(of meat, especially beef) To become interlaced with fat; (of fat) to interlace through meat.
(by extension) To lace or be laced throughout.
Made of, or resembling, marble.
definitions.example: a marble mantel

definitions.definition: Cold; hard; unfeeling.
definitions.example: a marble heart

definitions.definition: A mammal of the family Leporidae, with long ears, long hind legs and a short, fluffy tail.
definitions.example: The pioneers survived by eating the small game they could get: rabbits, squirrels and occasionally a raccoon.

definitions.definition: The meat from this animal.
The fur of a rabbit typically used to imitate another animal's fur.
A runner in a distance race whose goal is mainly to set the pace, either to tire a specific rival so that a teammate can win or to help another break a record; a pacesetter.
A very poor batsman; selected as a bowler or wicket-keeper.
A large element at the beginning of a list of items to be bubble sorted, and thus tending to be quickly swapped into its correct position. Compare turtle.
Rarebit; Welsh rabbit or a similar dish: melted cheese served atop toast.
To hunt rabbits.
To flee.
definitions.example: The informant seemed skittish, as if he was about to rabbit.

definitions.definition: To talk incessantly and in a childish manner; to babble annoyingly.
definitions.example: Stop your infernal rabbiting! Use proper words or nobody will listen to you!

definitions.definition: Confound; damn; drat.
A quality of endurance and courage.
Good temperament and character.
Metal; a metallic substance.
Having to do with the pope or the papacy.
A decorative border constructed from a continuous line, shaped into a repeated motif, that is commonly found in Greek art.
A structural motif in proteins consisting of four adjacent antiparallel strands and their linking loops.
One of the turns of a winding, crooked, or involved course.

definitions.definition: A tortuous or intricate movement.
One of a series of regular sinuous curves, bends, loops, turns, or windings in the channel of a river, stream, or other watercourse
Fretwork.
Perplexity.
A self-avoiding closed curve which intersects a line a number of times.
To wind or turn in a course or passage; to be intricate.

definitions.definition: To wind, turn, or twist; to make flexuous.
Aware of oneself as an individual being.
Uncomfortably over-conscious of one's appearance or behaviour.
Socially ill at ease.
A huge mass of ocean-floating ice which has broken off a glacier or ice shelf

definitions.definition: An aloof person.
(after an adjective) An impending disastrous event whose adverse effects are only beginning to show, in reference to one-tenth of the volume of an iceberg being visible above water.
The bark of the cork oak, which is very light and porous and used for making bottle stoppers, flotation devices, and insulation material.
A bottle stopper made from this or any other material.

definitions.definition: An angling float, also traditionally made of oak cork.
The cork oak, Quercus suber.
The dead protective tissue between the bark and cambium in woody plants, with suberin deposits making it impervious to gasses and water.
To seal or stop up, especially with a cork stopper.
To blacken (as) with a burnt cork
To leave the cork in a bottle after attempting to uncork it.
To fill with cork, as the center of a baseball bat.
definitions.example: He corked his bat, which was discovered when it broke, causing a controversy.

definitions.definition: To injure through a blow; to induce a haematoma.
definitions.example: The vicious tackle corked his leg.

definitions.definition: To position one's drift net just outside of another person's net, thereby intercepting and catching all the fish that would have gone into that person's net.
An aerialist maneuver involving a rotation where the rider goes heels over head, with the board overhead.
To perform such a maneuver.
Having the property of a head over heels rotation.
One who earns a living by trading goods or securities.
An artificial obstruction, such as a dam, in a river designed to increase its depth or to divert its flow.
A heavy curtain of artillery fire directed in front of one's own troops to screen and protect them.
A concentrated discharge of projectile weapons.
(by extension) An overwhelming outburst of words, especially of criticism.
A "next hit wins" contest to determine the winner of a bout in case of a tie.
Type of firework containing a mixture of firework types in one single-ignition package.
To direct a barrage at.
To intentionally inflict severe pain or suffering on (someone).
definitions.example: In the aftermath of 9/11, we did some things that were wrong. We did a whole lot of things that were right, but, we tortured some folks. We did some things that were contrary to our values.

definitions.definition: Having been subjected to torture, mental or physical.
Involving suffering and difficulty.

definitions.definition: Of literature, burdened by unnecessary complexity, obfuscation, abstruseness, etc.

definitions.definition: A substance used to polish.
definitions.example: A good silver polish will remove tarnish easily.

definitions.definition: Cleanliness; smoothness, shininess.
definitions.example: The floor was waxed to a high polish.

definitions.definition: Refinement; cleanliness in performance or presentation.
definitions.example: The lecturer showed a lot of polish at his last talk.

definitions.definition: To shine; to make a surface very smooth or shiny by rubbing, cleaning, or grinding.
definitions.example: He polished up the chrome until it gleamed.

definitions.definition: To refine; remove imperfections from.
definitions.example: The band has polished its performance since the last concert.

To become smooth, as from friction; to receive a gloss; to take a smooth and glossy surface.

definitions.definition: To refine; to wear off the rudeness, coarseness, or rusticity of; to make elegant and polite.
In a disastrous way. (Of the nature of a disaster; calamitously.)
A connection established over a telephone network between two parties.
The conversation held by the two parties on this connection.
Any of various rodents from Florida and southern Georgia, especially Neofiber alleni; the muskrat.
The rakali, Hydromys chrysogaster.
The European water vole, Arvicola amphibius, formerly Arvicola terrestris.

A person fond of water sports.
A member of the water police.

definitions.definition: Supreme tiredness; having exhausted energy.

The removal of all air from a vessel (the creation of a vacuum).
An exhaustive procedure
Criminal disloyalty to one's country.
An SI subunit of length equal to 10-9 metres. Symbol: nm

A pipe, used for smoking cannabis, open at both ends and having a bowl near one end; it rolls the smoke (steam)
To level a road using a steamroller
To proceed ruthlessly against all opposition as if with an overwhelming force; to overpower
The use of harmful microorganisms as a weapon of war.
Capable of being believed; credible.
Abounding in energy or playfulness

definitions.definition: Sexually aroused
Of, relating to, or coming from the north.
An often wooden structure that projects from a coastline to prevent erosion, longshore drift etc.; a breakwater.
Pants that are flared from the knee downwards, a characteristic style of the 1970s.
The amount that a spoon will hold, either level or heaped.
High fashion as produced in Paris and imitated in other fashion capitals such as New York, London, and Milan.
The fashion houses or fashion designers that create exclusive and often trendsetting fashions.

A turn or swerve; an instance of veering.

To turn.
